subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ... Coptic and Greek were disunified because there were substantial documents that contained both, each with its characteristic style. If such Shavian/QS
messageBody:
Ph.D. scripsit:

> I've been very busy lately, and I don't have time to
> look into this right now, but my first impression is
> that unifying Quikscript with Shavian makes the
> same mistake originally made in unifying Coptic
> with Greek.

Coptic and Greek were disunified because there were substantial
documents that contained both, each with its characteristic style.
If such Shavian/QS documents exist, we need to hear about them pronto.

> And would we need two different encodings for
> some characters so as to have a regular character
> and a combining character for Junior versus Senior
> Quikscript?

No, any more than a Latin handwriting font requires combining
(technically, conjoining) characters. SrQS may require some
special ligatures, but ligatures are a font issue, not a character
encoding issue.

--
In politics, obedience and support John Cowan <cowan@...>
are the same thing. --Hannah Arendt http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
